results.title: 'Screen It' 2010 [winning entries]
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ is Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students. Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fosters a new generation of young media makers.

In 2010 students were asked to create works responding to the theme ‘The Environment: Who Cares?’.

From 256 entries created by over 939 students nationwide, here are the winners:

Primary - Animation
Winner: Control Your Carbondioxides, Carey Baptist Grammar Junior School (Kew, VIC)
Runners Up:
The Reason I Hate News Reporters: The Global Warming Quiz, Glencoe Central Primary School (Glencoe, SA)
Best Place Ever!, Cabramatta Public School (Cabramatta, NSW)
Curse of the Were-Rubbish, Léon Othenin-Girard (Balwyn North, VIC)
The Last Frog, Keller Road Primary School (Salisbury East, SA)
Wilhelmina Wiggins, Table Cape Primary School (Wynyard, TAS)
Supa Poopa Scoopa, Hernani Public School (Hernani, NSW)

Primary - Live Action
Winner: One World, Poowong Consolidated School (Poowong, VIC)
Special Mention: CRASH!, Cabramatta Public School (Cabramatta, NSW)
Runners Up:
Stop the Dumping! An Investigation into Illegal Dumping in Glencoe, South Australia, Glencoe Central Primary School (Glencoe, SA)
Duck Duck Turtle, Orama Public School (Thora, NSW)
Enviro - Planetary Defender, Rouse Hill Public School (Rouse Hill, NSW)

Primary - Computer Game
Winner: Bins vs. Rubbish, Auburn Primary School (East Hawthorn, VIC)
Special Mention: Cleaning Beezzz, Tea Tree Gully Primary School (Tea Tree Gully, SA)
Runners Up:
The Adventures of Seed Boy, Glencoe Central Primary School (Glencoe, SA)
The Adventures of Green Man, Marlborough Primary School (Heathmont, VIC)

Secondary - Animation
Winner: Future, Parramatta Marist High School (Westmead, NSW)
Special Mention: Not Just Us, Sarah Sloan (Princes Hill, VIC)
Runners Up:
Welcome to ‘R’ Ville, Selina Finau (Woodpark, NSW)
Think Climate, Think Change, Maryanne Irhia (Kensington, NSW)
The Environment. Who Cares?, Overnewton Anglican Community College (Keilor, VIC)
Who Cares?, Sasha Mutch (Ringwood, VIC)

Secondary - Live Action
Winner: Long Live the Can, Andreas Stoffel (Halls Gap, VIC)
Special Mention: ZombieBusters, Gleneagles Secondary College (Endeavour Hills, VIC)
Runners Up:
The Environment: Who Cares?, Loxton High School (Loxton, SA)
Behind Nature’s Lines, Parramatta Marist High School (Westmead, NSW)
One Person’s Perspective, St Ursula’s College (Toowoomba, QLD)

Secondary - Computer Game
Winner: Turmoil, Cameron Panzenbock (Ingham QLD)
Greenie’s Excellent Adventure, Connor Mosca (Caboolture, QLD)
Mr. Ooga Booga Saves the Forrest, Imogen Lee (Caboolture, QLD)
Mr. Octopus Saves the Sea and the Sky, Jesse Lee (Caboolture, QLD)
Park Ranger, Luke Holdsworth (Donvale, VIC)
Trash Pick Up!, Christoffel Roelofse (Donvale VIC)

results.title: 'round and 'round
results.creator_credit: Barbara Greene, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: When Alex Lawson, minister, came to Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan, he recognized the need for a family self-help program. In cooperation with his parishioners, he organized the Minto Family Life Education Program. Through group meetings, they are learning new skills to help them restructure their lives and resolve personal problems. Though the people participating in this program live in a small Prairie town, their concerns are universal, like raising children, adolescence, loneliness, marital strife and alcoholism.

results.title: 'Rockthorpe' Tasmania.
results.brief_description: The story of the production of breeding ewes and rams required to maintain high quality Australian wool. Fifty years of experience at “Rockthorpe” stud farm in Tasmania, have produced the Polwarth sheep - a breed suited to both coastal and highland conditions. Shows how the use of a fleec measurement system, individual classification, and selection of breeding-stock brings outstanding results.

results.title: 'Rivers of fire': an eruption of Hawaii's Mauna Loa Volcano
results.creator_credit: Les Malzman, Jon Erickson, Kathleen English, United States. National Park Service and Hawaii Natural History Association
results.brief_description: Examines the twenty two day eruption of Mauna Loa, the world’s largest volcano which started on 25 March 1984. Explains the Hawaiian volcanoes with spectacular photography within a well structured presentation which includes excellent graphics of plate tectonics and the hot spot theory.
results.title_for_label: ‘Rivers of fire’: an eruption of Hawaii’s Mauna Loa Volcano

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.title: 'Remembrance of things past'...a watercolour memoir for Richard
results.brief_description: When Judith recalls Richard’s legacy, she sees it through his watercolour paintings that stand as a aesthetic record to his life, from his childhood to his adult academic pursuits.

results.title: 'On the wallaby track' by Frederick McCubbin, 1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Art Gallery of New South Wales and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Australian eye I”.
A study of the painting by Frederick McCubbin, “On the Wallaby Track”. Other major works of McCubbin are examined and the influence upon him of French genre painter Bastien-Lepage is discussed.

results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Lawrence P. Bachmann and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.

results.title: 'Mount William from Mount Dryden'...by Eugene Guerard, 1857
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “The Australian eye III”.
Eugene Von Guerard, (affectionately known as ‘the father of the Gallery School’ Victoria, being founder), with his training in the naturalistic German school of Romanticism, was able to produce works that express reverence for nature’s mysterious processes as well as appreciation of the splendours of the untamed Australian landscape. The European concept of sublimity is discussed and some of Von Guerard’s most majestic works are studied.
